verbs.description: Trump [V: has] demonstrated that he knows how to insult our closest international allies . What he seems incapable of demonstrating is a capacity for leadership .

Trump has demonstrated that [ARG0: he] [V: knows] [ARG1: how to insult our closest international allies] . What he seems incapable of demonstrating is a capacity for leadership .
Trump has demonstrated that [ARG0: he] knows [ARGM-MNR: how] to [V: insult] [ARG1: our closest international allies] . What he seems incapable of demonstrating is a capacity for leadership .
Trump has demonstrated that he knows how to insult our closest international allies . What he [V: seems] [ARG1: incapable of demonstrating] is a capacity for leadership .
Trump has demonstrated that he knows how to insult our closest international allies . [ARG1: What he seems incapable of demonstrating] [V: is] [ARG2: a capacity for leadership] .
